title: The Unbearable Lightness of Scones
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: And then there was a picture of boys, all in their uniforms, sitting about their fire singing a song. The book gave some of the words of the song, "One man and his dog, went to mow a meadow . . ." That sounded like a very exciting song, thought Bertie; so rich in meaning; and for a moment he imagined the man and his dog setting off to cut the grass in Drummond Place Gardens. And the man was Angus Lordie and the dog was Cyril, whom Bertie had always liked.

snippet: As they made their way out onto Dundonald Street, Cyril raised his head and sniffed at the air.
